header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 102/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000441­2019 ) Mohini Barate & Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application for Ad­Interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No. 454/2018 registered under Sections 313, 498­A, 494, 417, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station Khadak, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 313, 498­a, 494, 417, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] The crime has been registered on report of Sneha Barate. She alleged that, she knows accused Chetan Barate as he helped her in performing love marriage with Santosh Bhavsar. However, after marriage with Bhavsar, she came to know that, he is criminal minded. Therefore, in 2010 she obtained divorce. But during that period, there was friendship between accused Chetan and her. Accused Chetan assured her for marriage. Therefore, she started residing with him like his wife. She alleged that, in the year 2014 as there was no marriage between Chetan and her, the first abortion was taken place due to insistence of Chetan. In 2016 she married with accused Chetan. She again got pregnant, but accused Chetan made her to abort. She alleged that, accused Chetan used to ill­treat by abusing, threatening and beating. Thereafter, Chetan made her to reside with her parents at Shukrawar Peth, Pune and started avoiding her. Thereafter, she came to know that, accused Chetan has performed marriage with Applicant No. 2 Snehal and concealed this fact from her. As such, she lodged report against accused Chetan and present Applicants.

argumentSentences.text: 2] The crime has been registered on report of Sneha Barate.
She alleged that, she knows accused Chetan Barate as he helped her in performing love marriage with Santosh Bhavsar.
However, after marriage with Bhavsar, she came to know that, he is criminal minded.
Therefore, in 2010 she obtained divorce.
But during that period, there was friendship between accused Chetan and her.
Accused Chetan assured her for marriage.
Therefore, she started residing with him like his wife.
She alleged that, in the year 2014 as there was no marriage between Chetan and her, the first abortion was taken place due to insistence of Chetan.
In 2016 she married with accused Chetan.
She again got pregnant, but accused Chetan made her to abort.
She alleged that, accused Chetan used to ill­treat by abusing, threatening and beating.
Thereafter, Chetan made her to reside with her parents at Shukrawar Peth, Pune and started avoiding her.
Thereafter, she came to know that, accused Chetan has performed marriage with Applicant No. 2 Snehal and concealed this fact from her.
As such, she lodged report against accused Chetan and present Applicants.

arguments.text: 3] Applicants submit that, they have no role in the alleged crime. Applicant No. 1 is mother and Applicant No. 2 is wife of accused Chetan, therefore, Informant made them as accused. No role has been attributed to them. Accused Chetan is already arrested. Applicants submit that, they are ladies. No recovery is pending against them. Therefore, they may be protected by granting Interim Anticipatory Bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicants submit that, they have no role in the alleged crime.
Applicant No. 1 is mother and Applicant No. 2 is wife of accused Chetan, therefore, Informant made them as accused.
No role has been attributed to them.
Accused Chetan is already arrested.
Applicants submit that, they are ladies.
No recovery is pending against them.
Therefore, they may be protected by granting Interim Anticipatory Bail.

arguments.text: 4] Heard learned Adv. S. T. Zalte for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard learned Adv. S. T. Zalte for Applicants.
Perused the FIR and Papers.

arguments.text: 5] Prima facie, the main allegations are against accused Chetan who is behind the bars. No specific role is attributed to present Applicants. Moreover, both the Applicants are ladies having roots in the society. No immediate recovery is pending, hence, immediate custody of the Applicants is not necessary. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Prima facie, the main allegations are against accused Chetan who is behind the bars.
No specific role is attributed to present Applicants.
Moreover, both the Applicants are ladies having roots in the society.
No immediate recovery is pending, hence, immediate custody of the Applicants is not necessary.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending herein final disposal of main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 454/2018 registered under Sections 313, 498­A, 494, 417, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station Khadak, Pune, Applicants 1] Smt. Mohini Rajendra Barate and 2] Snehal Chetan Barate be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) each on the following conditions : [A] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [B] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to respondent state returnable on 17/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 102/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000441­2019 ) Mohini Barate & Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application for Ad­Interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No. 454/2018 registered under Sections 313, 498­A, 494, 417, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station Khadak, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] The crime has been registered on report of Sneha Barate. She alleged that, she knows accused Chetan Barate as he helped her in performing love marriage with Santosh Bhavsar. However, after marriage with Bhavsar, she came to know that, he is criminal minded. Therefore, in 2010 she obtained divorce. But during that period, there was friendship between accused Chetan and her. Accused Chetan assured her for marriage. Therefore, she started residing with him like his wife. She alleged that, in the year 2014 as there was no marriage between Chetan and her, the first abortion was taken place due to insistence of Chetan. In 2016 she married with accused Chetan. She again got pregnant, but accused Chetan made her to abort. She alleged that, accused Chetan used to ill­treat by abusing, threatening and beating. Thereafter, Chetan made her to reside with her parents at Shukrawar Peth, Pune and started avoiding her. Thereafter, she came to know that, accused Chetan has performed marriage with Applicant No. 2 Snehal and concealed this fact from her. As such, she lodged report against accused Chetan and present Applicants. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicants submit that, they have no role in the alleged crime. Applicant No. 1 is mother and Applicant No. 2 is wife of accused Chetan, therefore, Informant made them as accused. No role has been attributed to them. Accused Chetan is already arrested. Applicants submit that, they are ladies. No recovery is pending against them. Therefore, they may be protected by granting Interim Anticipatory Bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard learned Adv. S. T. Zalte for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers. 
---argument-ends---
5] Prima facie, the main allegations are against accused Chetan who is behind the bars. No specific role is attributed to present Applicants. Moreover, both the Applicants are ladies having roots in the society. No immediate recovery is pending, hence, immediate custody of the Applicants is not necessary. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending herein final disposal of main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 454/2018 registered under Sections 313, 498­A, 494, 417, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station Khadak, Pune, Applicants 1] Smt. Mohini Rajendra Barate and 2] Snehal Chetan Barate be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) each on the following conditions : [A] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [B] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to respondent state returnable on 17/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
